3.t: by the odd and even (8th and 9th Dhil-hajj)

4.t: and by the night when it moves on towards daybreak (reward and retribution in the next life is an absolute reality).

5.t: Is this not a sufficient oath for intelligent people?
5.tr: Hal fee zaalika qasamul lizee hijr

6.t: (Muhammad), consider how your Lord dealt with the tribe of Ad,
6.tr: Alam tara kaifa fa'ala rabbuka bi'aad

7.t: the people of the huge columned city of Eram

8.t: whose like has never been created in any other land.
8.tr: Allatee lam yukhlaq misluhaa fil bilaad

9.t: (Also consider how He dealt with) the Thamud, who carved their houses out of the rocks in the valley.

10.t: (Also consider the people of) the Pharaoh who victimized people by placing them on the stake,

12.t: and spread much corruption in the land.

13.t: Thus, your Lord afflicted them with torment;

14.t: your Lord keeps an eye on (all evil-doing people).

15.t: As for the human being, when his Lord tests him, honors him, and grants him bounty, he says, "God has honored me".
15.tr: Fa-ammal insaanu izaa mab talaahu Rabbuhoo fa-akramahoo Wa-na'-'amahoo fa-yaqoolu Rabbeee akraman

16.t: However, when his Lord tests him by a measured amount of sustenance, he says, "God has disgraced me".
16.tr: Wa-ammaaa izaa mab talaahu faqadara 'alaihi rizqahoo fa-yaqoolu Rabbeee ahaanan

17.t: (Since wealth does not necessarily guarantee everlasting happiness) then why do you not show kindness to the orphans,

18.t: or urge one another to feed the destitute?

19.t: Why do you take away the inheritance of others indiscriminately

20.t: and why do you have an excessive love of riches?

21.t: When the earth is crushed into small pieces
21.tr: Kallaaa izaaa dukkatil ardu dakkan dakka

22.t: and (when you find yourself) in the presence of your Lord and the rows and rows of angels, your greed for riches will certainly be of no avail to you.

23.t: On that day, hell will be brought closer and the human being will come to his senses, but this will be of no avail to him.
23.tr: Wa-jeee'a yawma'izim bi-jahannnam; Yawma-'iziny yatazakkarul insaanu Wa-annaa lahuz zikraa

24.t: He will say, "Would that I had done some good deeds for this life".

25.t: On that day the punishment of God and His detention will be unparalleled.

26.t: And His bonds will be such as none other can bind.

28.t: return to your Lord well pleased with him and He will be pleased with you.
